org.jredis.ri.alphazero
Class SocketConnection

java.lang.Object
  org.jredis.ri.alphazero.SocketConnection
Direct Known Subclasses:
SynchConnection
public class SocketConnection
extends java.lang.Object

[TODO: reconnect, timeoout, etc. ] A delegating Protocol that is mainly responsible for managing the network connection to the redis server, and in support of the ProtocolHandler#serviceRequest(Command, byte[]...) method uses another, redis version specific, protool handler to provide support for createRequest and createResponse methods. This class will provide the IO streams required by Request and Response objects to be send and received.

This client will open and maintain a single socket connection to the server identified and [TODO] will handle reconnects and timeouts (which is why it is in the loop as a Protocol.

This class only supports the ProtocolHandler#serviceRequest(Command, byte[]...) method of the communication aspects of the protocol handler to insure control over the sequence and modality of message processing.

This class is not (as of now 04/02/09) thread-safe.

Since:
alpha.0
Version:
alpha.0, 04/02/09
Author:
Joubin Houshyar (alphazero@sensesay.net)
